tool.name: SAGA.ta_morphometry.19
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayDEM False output_data_LANDFORMS $output_data_LANDFORMS name SAGA.ta_morphometry.19 DEM $DEM RADIUS_A_MIN $RADIUS_A_MIN RADIUS_A_MAX $RADIUS_A_MAX RADIUS_B_MIN $RADIUS_B_MIN RADIUS_B_MAX $RADIUS_B_MAX DW_WEIGHTING $DW_WEIGHTING DW_IDW_POWER $DW_IDW_POWER DW_IDW_OFFSET $DW_IDW_OFFSET DW_BANDWIDTH $DW_BANDWIDTH prefer $prefer response $response outputType_LANDFORMS $OutputSection_LANDFORMS.outputType_LANDFORMS transmissionMode_LANDFORMS $OutputSection_LANDFORMS.transmissionMode_LANDFORMS

param.name: DEM
param.label: Elevation
param.help: Elevation The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid, png

param.name: DW_IDW_OFFSET
param.label: Inverse Distance Offset
param.help: Calculates weights for distance plus one, avoiding division by zero for zero distances

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_LANDFORMS
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_LANDFORMS
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: Topographic Position Index (TPI) calculation as proposed by Guisan et al. (1999). This is literally the same as the difference to the mean calculation (residual analysis) proposed by Wilson & Gallant (2000). The bandwidth parameter for distance weighting is given as percentage of the (outer) radius.
